title.narrative: AUC Institutions, Capacity Building and Communications (2014-15)

description.narrative:
Den institutionella förändringen av AÚ Kommissionen (AUC) lanserades 2005 och betonade behov av genomsyn av Kommissionens IT-system samt andra identifierade områden som var i behov av att ses över och anpassas. Under 2009 antog AUC ett mer omfattande institutionellt kapacitetsuppbyggnadsprogram "AUC Instituions and Capacity Building Program 2009-2013 (ICBP)".
För de fyra åren (2014 - 2017) kommer ICBC-programmet inriktas på att främja organisatoriska förändringar och stärka den institutionella kapaciteten i AUC genom att åtgärder för att förbättra sina resultat och den operativa effektiviteten kring ekonomi, HR, administration och institutionellt ledarskap.
Förstärkning av den institutionella kapaciteten hos AUC är avgörande för att göra det möjligt för Kommissionen att genomföra sitt uppdrag. Interventionen är av mycket hög relevans för både Sveriges och AUC:s strategiska prioriteringar samt för andra likasinnade partner, liksom Afrikansa Unionens medlemsstater.

The AU establishes and oversees implementation of collective African principles, commitments and standards. It is the only body with the political mandate to work at continental level to press for improvements across Africa, working on behalf of all its member states.
The institutional transformation of the AUC was launched in 2005 emphasizing the needs of the Commission’s IT systems and identifying areas that needed to be reviewed and adjusted to take on its mandates. In 2009, the AUC adopted a more comprehensive institutional capacity building programme ‘AUC Institutions and Capacity Building Programme 2009 - 2013 (ICBP)’.
For the next four years (2014 – 2017), the ICBC programme will focus on promoting organizational change and strengthening the institutional capacity of the AUC by putting in place measures to improve its performance and operational efficiency in terms of finance, human resources, administration, institutional leadership and corporate governance.
The enhancement of the institutional capacity of the AUC is crucial to enable the Commission to take on its mandate successfully. The intervention is also of very high relevance to the declared strategic priorities of both Sweden and the AUC, as well as of other likeminded partners, and to the ultimate beneficiaries of the AU – its Member States.

description.narrative: General question: Results related to the intended outcome 2015Question: Summarise results related to the intended outcome (this information will be sent to Open Aid)Answer: The Commission has made progess in recent years to improve its institutional capacities and operational systems and procedures. For example, the continued implementation of IPSAS has led to the publication of the audited financial statement of the AU for 2014 on the AU webpage for the first time (although only in early 2016). The operationalisation of the new financial rules and regulations and the new procurement manual in 2016 will lead to a significant reduction of audit findings and it is expected that it will lead to corresponding improvements in its procurement. SAP budget and grant management modules are also being developed. In addition, given continuous improvements in the IT infrastructure, travel and paper use has been reduced. These are just a few of the improvements and numoerous challenges and bottlenecks remain.
